clinical_study.brief_title: The Impact Of Platelet Function on 1-year Outcome in Complex PCI Patients
clinical_study.official_title: The Impact Of Platelet Function on 1-year Outcome in Complex PCI Patients

lead_sponsor.agency: Chinese Academy of Medical Sciences, Fuwai Hospital

clinical_study.source: Chinese Academy of Medical Sciences, Fuwai Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: To identify the optimal cut-off values in different platelet function testing to predict MACCE at 12-months in complex PCI patients of China

detailed_description.textblock: This study will observe the relationship between platelet function testing and clinical outcomes. Meanwhile we aim to identify optimal cut-off values in different platelet function testing, including IPF, TEG and VerifyNow, to predict MACCE during12-months in complex PCI patients.

primary_outcome.measure: Optimal cut-off values in different platelet function testing to predict MACCE at 12-months in complex PCI patients of China

secondary_outcome.measure: Effectiveness and sensitivity of predicting between different platelet function testing

study_pop.textblock: Patients with complex PCI were defined as having at least 1of the following features :3 vessels treated,≥3 stents implanted, ≥3 lesions treated,bifurcation with 2stents implanted ,total stent length >60 mm or chronic total occlusion.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Documented undergoing complex PCI in 1 year prior to enrollment.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Presence of any condition/circumstance which in the opinion of the investigator could significantly limit the complete follow up of the patient (e.g. tourist, non-native speaker or does not understand the local language where interpreter services are not reliably available, psychiatric disturbances, alcohol or drug abuse).
- Presence of serious/severe co-morbidities in the opinion of the investigator which may limit life expectancy (<1 year).
- Current participation in a blinded randomized clinical trial.
